servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: P2A01: O2 Sensor Circuit Range / Performance (Bank 1, Sensor 2)

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of HO2S signal circuit is lower than 0.4 V (A/F mixture: lean state) for 40 sec.
Output voltage of HO2S signal circuit is higher than 0.85 V (A/F mixture: rich state) for 40 sec.

item.ptxt: When performing a road test, select a place where there is no traffic or possibility of a traffic accident and be very careful during testing to avoid occurrence of an accident.
Road test should be carried out by 2 persons, a driver and a tester, on a level road.
If DTC other than aimed DTC are previously detected in DTC confirmation procedure, be sure to troubleshoot DTC previously detected.
Check to make sure that the following conditions are satisfied when using this procedure.

s1.ptxt: Start engine and warm up to operating temperature.
Drive vehicle at 50 – 80 km/h (31 – 50 mile/h) for 5 min. at 5th gear or D range. (Keep throttle valve opening constantly in this step.)
Release accelerator pedal, and keep vehicle coasting for 10 sec. with engine braking applied. (fuel cut condition.)
Stop vehicle and run engine at idle speed for 5 min.
Check whether O2 sensor readiness/monitoring test has completed or not by using scan tool.
If O2 sensor readiness/monitoring test has not completed, check vehicle conditions (environmental) and repeat Steps 2) through 4).

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:J24B .

testgroup.title: DTC check
testgroup.question: Is there DTC(s) other than P2A01?

test1.ptxt: Check signal and ground circuits of HO2S for high resistance referring to step 3 of DTC P0137 / P0138:J24B .

action.ptxt: Replace HO2S and recheck. If this DTC is detected again, substitute a known-good ECM.
Repair or replace defective wire harness / connector.
